relation: Great for these types of students
Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus
Saw security when I first walked in. Thats a good thing!
The amount of money you will make considering the amount you spend for school is good!
They have yoga classes and clubs to join! Make sure you socialize.
Have not experienced yet but they do have a cafeteria to purchase bagels, croissants, and other breakfast foods. I have only been there in the morning.
Make sure you ask all the questions you have and don't let them rush past you to help the next student. Apply for all the scholarships you can, whenever you can!

The campus is under construction, but the buildings they are working on or building are nice. The student aides are wonderful but some of the teachers or employees don't see too interested in helping when you have questions. The new student orientation was helpful.

The Students Center just opened in the summer of 2011 and is a wonderful option for students who dont want to walk too far from campus to grab a bite to eat., 202317=Currently unavailable, but will be availalbe by March 2014., 127255=The Norfolk Campus Tidewater community college was the first campus to have a student center it open on May 23,2011 that is a place were students can hang out in between classes it has five floors . The first floor is open to the public which has two cafes on that floor . The other floors can only be access if you are a tcc student with an tcc id card which is provide by the school once you are enrolled into classess., 401654=TCC doesn't have a dorm because it is a community college. TCC offers day-care starting in the beginning of January or February. Also they offer employment for students that want to work part-time while they are in school., 130464=Hello prospective students i use to be open of you but then I was at the beach and I was thinking i do not just want a high school diploma because that will not get me very far in life. So on March 2,2011 i decide to enroll into school and that was the best thing i did so far in my life.}

textAfterTable: Bang for the buck The prices for this school are decent and I love the way financial aid works. Before you go to the bookstore you get a little slip of paper saying how much you have in your financial aid account & what all you can spend it on. I have been enrolled here a full year now and have not spent a penny on my school. Am enjoying being here I love the area that the Virginia Beach campus is is. It's easy to find & it's just ten miles from the ocean front! The only problem I have had is that one evening my car was broken into in the TCC parking lot, but nothing was stolen. Am learning a lot So far, all but two of my teachers that I have had were wonderful. If you are majoring in sociology or Microsoft Office I would research your teachers hard before signing up for your classes. Login to rate or flag the reviews Kristin from ASTORIA, NY 02/07/2013 Reviewer is A past student here.
